intro: Cupania pyriformis, commonly known as the pear-shaped cupania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pear-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants.
